item.title: Defiant joy as Sydney Harbour packed for New Year's Eve spectacular
item.description: <p>Australia has welcomed in 2026, led by a defiantly joyous celebration on Sydney Harbour just weeks after the Bondi Beach attack.</p>

item.title: World parties at New Year's Eve celebrations to bring an end to 2025
item.description: <p>Clocks strike midnight in Auckland, a population of 1.7 million, 18 hours before the famous ball drops in New York&#x27;s Times Square.</p>

item.title: Three drowning deaths, two people missing in horror 36 hours in NSW
item.description: <p>Wild weather has closed more than 60 beaches, including in Sydney, with dangerous conditions making venturing into the water unsafe.</p>

item.title: Monsoonal deluge continues to batter northern Queensland as region remains on flood watch
item.description: <p>Coastal areas between Townsville and Bowen are expected to be lashed with 100 to 200mm rain today, with higher totals possible on the coastal fringe, all the way up to Cairns.</p>

item.title: Group on the run after two men attacked with machetes outside Melbourne restaurant
item.description: <p>T﻿he men are in hospital after they were set upon by a group of about seven males shortly before midnight.</p>

item.title: Teen charged after firecracker sparks large blaze in Perth Hills
item.description: <p>Police allege the 19-year-old threw a firecracker into dry grass in bushland in Kalamunda, east of Perth Airport, about 12.20am.</p>

item.title: Dozens feared dead in New Year's Eve fire at Swiss Alps bar
item.description: Dozens of people are presumed dead and 100 are injured after a fire at a bar in the Swiss Alps during New Y...

item.title: Aussie cattle farmers dealt blow as China slaps cap on beef imports
item.description: <p>From yesterday, China is slapping limits on beef imports from overseas. Anything exceeding the cap will be hit with a 55 per cent tax rate.</p>
